Reviews.Title: “trust me ! you want this hotel ! :)”
Reviews.Author: meital z
Reviews.Content: hello everyone! i got back last week from my first vacation in Rome, i had the best trip i can ever imagine... and a big part of it was the wounderful hotel: "residenza di ripetta". i stayed at the hotel with my friend for 5 nights. it is all about the location and the kindness of the hotel staff. it was very easy to get from the hotel to the historic places such as trevi fountain,piazza di spagna, the pantheon, the colosso and many many more !!! if you want to take a trip without using transportation and enjoy the walk and the atmosphere in the streets you must stay in this hotel. from the moment we arrived we felt the family atmosphere in the hotel , the reception desk staff was very friendly and helpful especially Stefano,Frank and sweet Francesca who helped my buy a memory card for my camera, gave me a map with full direction to the closest store- this is what i call a great service :) i loved the room and the breakfast. i hope you will enjoy your stay like i did. i miss Rome already and can't wait to stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: EYJones
Reviews.Content: My favorite thing about this hotel is its location. Only a block over from bustling shopping streets and a few blocks away from the Spanish Steps and metro, Via di Ripetta itself is quiet and peaceful. Right across from the hotel is an excellent restaurant Bucca di Ripetta. This boutique hotel is beautiful and the rooms are unique and full of character. We stayed in a suite, which was lovely and very comfortale. Breakfast every morning was delicious, but we did not eat dinner in the hotel. The only downside was the internet was very expensive and I actually never got to use it because of some problem with the connection. It would be great if there was wireless in the rooms or at least the lobby area. In all we greatly enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend to others and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit in love with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: treaclebum5000
Reviews.Content: For a start, the location of this hotel is nothing short of perfect. A lot of hotels are by the train station, which is a scummy area, and I know people whose impressions of Rome have been tainted by this. The Residenza di Ripetta though is in a gorgeous area, right by a fabulous big piazza but on a quiet residential street. It's a stones throw from the Spanish Steps and within spitting distance of lovely bars and restaurants. Also, the metro is close by, just a skip across the piazza. We had a junior standard suite and loved everything about it. Lots of room. Separate room from the bedroom with a sofa and table and chairs was fantastic. Television in the bedroom was great and both rooms had windows overlooking the courtyard, which we could open completely and let air flow through. Bathroom was excellent also, and included a bidet. AND we had a kitchenette, which was useful. The maid cleaned every day. Everything just felt so fresh and airy. Bliss. Breakfast was nice, lots of choice. You could tell who the Brits were though, hanging around for more bacon, and the sausage isn't sausage as i know it but you never seriously go to the continent expecting a decent fry up to you? Lots of coffee, tea, fresh fruit, bread, condiments, pastry and juice. I love Rome and can't wait to go back. I think this hotel may have played a part in nurturing that love. We got it on a deal because they were renovating the courtyard and rooms at the time, but if I can afford it I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: dagm681
Reviews.Content: Got a room on arrival on 1st floor which was on the outside (ie not looking into inner courtyard) which was a bit airless so we opened the window. Regrettably the noise from the street below kept us awake but no problem, we were moved the following morning to a room looking into the courtyard which was great! The rooms were very functional though the bathroom a little tired with a small shower in the bath. Breakfasts were great and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel was excellent and made walking to restaurants very easy which was a big plus! We want to go back! Thanks to the porter who waked with us to get a taxi for us (the Rome marathon was on the day we left which made vehicle access difficult).

Reviews.Title: “A great time at the Residenza di Ripetta”
Reviews.Author: peddero
Reviews.Content: Booked on a secret deal so we had no idea what we were getting Turned out to be. fantastic as the other reviewers say the service here is excellent and friendly, nothing is to much trouble. The room was a suite! including a mini kitchen and fridge. Everything was clean stylish and the bed was changed (not just made) every day. Fully stocked mini bar and the usual toiletries etc in the bathroom. one small complaint there was no tea/coffee making facilities in our room which we would have appreciated however we didn't bother to ask and they may have been available Breakfast was varied and plentiful. We dined out so can't comment on the restaurant, which looked very nice. we tried the bar but it was expensive compared to the other local bars which probably explains why it was empty. Would we go back YES would we recommend this hotel YES should you book it YES

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location with personal service”
Reviews.Author: Sleeptight1984
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a lovely stay at Residenza di ripetta. The staff were all lovely and very helpful. The location is fantastic, within easy walking distance to Trevi fountain, Spanish Steps etc. However extras are very costly! Internet was extremely expensive at 17euro for 24hr! Also, I couldn't help but mark down on cleanliness. The maid hardly cleaned the room at all. In fact, the bathroom sink hadn't been touched. I was disappointed that my iPhone charger went missing after maid service in the room. I did report this to the staff as I was searching for it in room but alas it was never found which put a sour end to an otherwise pleasant stay. No compensation was offered, just "I hope it's in your luggage" which of course I knew it wasn't! Despite the problems with the bathroom cleanliness and iPhone charger going missing (which I assumed must have been an accident on the maids part) I would stay again and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, brill location, fabulous staff..”
Reviews.Author: ginny h
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the weekend before Christmas as we were seeing a show at the Eliseo. Great value for money, and even better location. Staff very helpful on handful of times we needed them. . Great value in restaurant where them booked us Porto di Ripetta, will return here if visiting Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: eduard s
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this nice hotel for a weed and I was very impressed by the kindness of the staff and the cleanliness. I had chosen this hotel for the location and it is excellent. it is a short walk from the most beautifull streets and monuments. the historic center on Rome is very big but if you have the hotel in a good position you can avoid taking the bus or metro. the rooms are beatiful and have nice furniture and also have a little kitchen for a small meal. I recommed it to all

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Room”
Reviews.Author: estragha
Reviews.Content: Great location, lovely helpful and friendly staff and nice communal areas however our room was very poor. There was a large patch of mould growing on the bathroom ceiling, the wood around bath behind the bathroom door is so old it is rotting and bathroom and room were generally run down and depressing. Oddly our room had a cooker (that we did not need) plates and a tea pot but we had to ask for a glass. The hallway to our room was also damp and smelt like there had recently been a flood. We booked this room on Last Minute as a Secret Hotel and even though we only paid around £100 a night I think it was too much considering they list themselves as a luxurious oasis. I suspect there are lovely rooms in this hotel however avoid Room H as it lacks any character whatsoever and has the appearance of a dilapidated 70s hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “THE Best Place To Stay In Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Giorgetta K
Reviews.Content: This is the 6th time that I have stayed at Residenza di Ripetta. I have been coming here since I was 1 and everytime I stay here I feel like i'm at home. The rooms come equipped with state of the art flat screen tvs and you can order a movie for just 15 euros. Also there is an air conditioning and heating system and internet for a reasonable price. Either 10 euros for 1 day or 20 euros for 3 days! There are rooms that face the garden or onto via di ripetta. I suggest the ones facing the garden, there is not as much noise as the ones that face onto via di ripetta. Breakfast is included and it's very diverse. There is scrambled eggs with sausage or bacon, variety of different cakes and pastries, different types of juices, cereal and deli items. Overall I was very impressed with breakfast. The rooms are cleaned each day and each day you have clean sheets and a new set of towels. Also there is a refridgerator in each room with a variety of beverages. However you must pay for them if you drink them that also goes for the snacks that come with the room. The service in general is excellent. There is always someone at the desk who can help you with anyone of your questions. Angelo is very professional and not only speaks english and italian but also spanish and french. He has been there the longest so if you need to ask something you should ask him. Every thursday and sunday there is a happy hour from 7:30pm - 10:30pm. It is either hosted in the inner garden which is spectacular or in the inside bar. I suggest that at least one night you should go to the happy hour, its fun and the music is great. Good way to meet some new people. Also every sunday there is a brunch at 12:30pm. There is a buffet and depending on the weather you can either sit in the garden or inside. The food overall is great!. You can also have a party there seeing as there are many different rooms. Not only is it good for pleasure but also for business. There are a total of 7 different rooms and depending on your business meeting you can choose any of the rooms. Another plus side to this hotel is that its located within a 5 minute walk from Piazza del Popolo and via del corso!. It is also a short walk to Spanish Steps!. Perfect for any type of stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best Gem in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Luigi K
Reviews.Content: I had a 3-week stay in Rome, and to be honest, was blown away by what RdR had to offer. I have stayed at other hotels in Rome with no luck. My cousins then told me that the next time i was in Rome, to stay here. Not only is the included breakfeast great, but the service was helpful. Not once in this 3-week stay did i have to wait for a hot capuchino in the morning. The staff at the desk and around the hotel were willing to help 24/7, which is more than enough. This was a solo trip, but i was entertained by what each room had to offer. The TV's are large and very nice. One feature that i found was that you can purchase internet, movies and everything else for use on the TV for only 15 Euros per day! Even more exciting was the mini fridge, which was alredy full with any drink i so desiered. Angelo at the desk spoke very good english and pointed out ways i could get to places like the Spanish steps and the Pantheon. Even more helpful was that the desk could call a taxi from the hotel! Even when Angelo was not there, the rest of the staff was willing to help out anyone who nedded it. In general, the residenza is very spacious and cozy. I would recomend this hotel to anyone who visits Rome with relaxation in mind. And to think there are great resturants for lunch and dinner nearby! Overall i would give this hotel a perfect five, and i will be back very soon. This place is amazing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place with amazing staff!!”
Reviews.Author: dmsrdh
Reviews.Content: We had a very short stay in Rome, but could not have been more impressed with RdR. From the extremely cool outdoor eating area, the amazing (included) breakfast,and the ever-helpful and genuinely kind staff, we left Rome thinking of the next time we'd be back to stay at the RdR. Angelo at the front desk was able to speak excellent English and assist with our early check-in so we could get to our tour of the Vatican without worrying about our luggage. He also gave us a free map of the city (highlighting the places we wanted to go) that easily got us around. Ervin was a sweetheart. He waited on us for dinner and always seemed to be around when you needed something. Our food that evening and the cont. breakfast the next day were amazing. We are very picky and healthy eaters, and were able to find plenty things to eat reasonably at RdR. The location was perfect for us. Easy to get to the subway, a taxi or a bus if you need to. I picked this area because we wanted to do the "Night walk" from Rick Steves' Italy book. This hotel is at the end of the walk, so we saw the whole heart of the city from 2 different angles in the same night walking to the start one way, and returning the way the book recommends. Highly recommend this book and the tips/places he highly recommends. Our whole 2 weeks in Italy it was our go to resource, and we were never disappointed. Our room was tiny, maybe the smallest one in the place, but it was clean and comfortable. The beds in Italy in general suck, and this was the best mattress by far. Great shower and updated bathroom, just outdated room. Honestly, we could care less about that as long as it was clean. The RdR also held onto our bags (no extra fee) our last day so we could see more of the city after we checked out. Overall, these people and this place is amazing! We'll be back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “NIce stay in the heart of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Karl S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Residenza di Ripetta for the 2nd time. I went to Rome in 2010 and stayed there with my parents and it was amazing! Now, I returned to spend 5 days in Rome with my girlfriend, my cousin and his wife, and I chose RdR, for their location, comfort, cleanliness and quality! I really love that place and intend to come back over and over again! Walking distance to anything in Rome and few steps from Piazza Del Popolo and Flaminio subway station. The only thing I don't understand and didn't like, is the internet policy in this hotel. The daily rate is not cheap, but it's ok due the hotel category! But they should have free internet connection in the rooms. Instead, they charge 5 euro/hour, or 10 euro/day, or 20 euro/3 days and you have to go to the lobby to connect. This is ridiculous! A lot of much cheaper hotels have free high speed internet for their guests! But even that, I will come back there and forget internet during my stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a pity. A total Fake”
Reviews.Author: IrishArgentine
Reviews.Content: The hotel NEEDS urgent refurbishment. It could be one of the best hotels in Rome because of size of rooms and location but the services are VERY VERY BAD. No internet whatsoever (even if you pay for it) and the rooms are extremely warm and old fashioned. No air conditioning in a 4 star hotel in Rome with 32 degrees!! Unbelievable!

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected!”
Reviews.Author: jemetty
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not what my bf and I thought we signed up for. We were in Rome in July 2011 meeting up with friends who were staying at The First Luxury Hotel right next door. We did our research and looked for a hotel that was better priced than their hotel which was about $400 a night and finally narrowed our pick to this hotel. The lobby and common areas are very nice but the rooms and staff leave alot to be desired for the price that was paid. The rooms are very old with ugly dirty yellow carpeting, the bed is not comfortable with just a small sheet and 2 very small pillows. The rooms are suites so they are spacious but the decorating is very outdated and very dark and just make everything feel old and very dirty. The washroom look clean but also very old but the shower was terrible as it was a small stream of water and took almost 2 minutes to get your entire body wet. Our safe was broken and we called to the front desk to ask for someone to come and look at it and the answer we recieved was "there is nothing we can do" so we had to take our passports and valuables next door to our friends hotel. Since the rooms use only old key locks you can not get an extra key. Our fuse in our room blew twice and my bf had the switch the fuse as the staff was taking a while to come and help us out. I personally was not impressed with this hotel and would not recommend the hotel to someone else. We did not eat in the common areas so we can not rate the food but the hotel food was very expensive. The area is great and close to everything. If you can afford The First Hotel which is right across the road from this hotel after seeing their ammenities, service and rooms I would highly reccomend it and definitly not this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in the middle of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Davemichellel
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel in the middle of Rome. reasonable priced, clean and luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kezza54
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights, a lovley hotel in a good location, the suite was very spacious and very comfortable, the breakfast buffet was excellant the service dreadful... I had 4 waiting staff look at me and none approached me to offer tea or coffee, I had to go into the diningroom and ask for service, a shame as this was the only negative I have for this hotel. Very expensive mini bar, so don't use it...

Reviews.Title: “Awful stay”
Reviews.Author: Ambrosoli
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights. We asked by our reservation if the re-constructions were finished, the answer was "yes", but at our arrival we realised this was a lie. Our in advance reserved suite of € 470!!! did not have an additional couch bed for our visiting six-year-old grandchild as announced in the hotel's description. The hotel provided us with a folding bed with a thin foam rubber mattress of bad quality and charged € 100 for each night for this service. The kitchen lacked of crockery so that it was not to be used at all. Only on request some few cups and plates were brought into the kitchen but they were old, dirty and seemed to be used already. Although the bedroom was directed towards an inner courtyard this didn't belong to the hotel, it was unbearably noisy because the entrances of at least ten apartments were situated there. On the first day no free tables in the breakfast room, on the second day not a four-table although several families were in the hotel. Always something was missing from the buffet: coffee, scrambled eggs, juice, cheese, ham...The staff worked hard but did not make it. On vacation one can be patient, that's fine, but for a 4-star hotel with such prices? In general, the staff was rather unfriendly and moody for inexplicable reasons. As soon as possible, after tree nights, we decided to move out and looked for another hotel. I would definitely never go to that place again and of course would never recommend it to anyone else ..! Very very... very bad! So sad for such a historic place and building.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, beautiful hotel, wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: NickiKent
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the Residenza we were looked after by the very attentive staff. The hotel is beautiful - lovely large rooms with high ceilings complete with kitchenettes. Breakfast was more than adequate and in a beautiful location adorned with fresh flowers and tended to by very friendly staff. The cocktail bar opened on our last evening and was a lovely treat (in the courtyard)! The hotel is wonderfully located to walk to most of the usual Rome attractions and the taxi journey from the airport cost around €45 (about 45 mins journey). I would thoroughly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: m0zart05
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night trip to rome in the Ripetta hotel. Before booking I trawled through many reviews and finally chose this one based on location and price. When we arrived we were told we had been upgraded to a better room free of charge. The hotel staff were friendly and welcoming and first impressions were good. Our room was on the 3rd floor and was huge. We had a separate lounge area with a tv, sofas and a table and chairs. The bedroom was a nice size too with a nice big bathroom. So far so good! The bed was a little hard, but we actually found it to be quite comfortable. We had a few small complaints: Our air conditioning did not work and it was uncomfortable at night. this was in May too, so I imagine it may be unbearable in the heat of summer. Our windows opened onto the internal courtyard so we had no real breeze or fresh air through. Second, the mini bar prices. In general we found Rome to be ridiculously expensive, but the mini bar was just outrageous! 8 Euros for a tiny bottle of coke!! In fact all of the soft drinks were this price! we bought water and drinks from the local shop and used the fridge. Problem solved! Our room was a little dated, but it was clean and more than adequate for our needs. Breakfast was average, but then it was included in the price. I would not have been eating in the hotel for breakfast if we had to pay extra for it. We had a couple of drinks in the hotel bar one night and the staff were lovely and friendly. Its a cosy little bar. We didnt eat in the restaurant so cant comment on that. Location of the hotel was GREAT! we walked to most places and the hop on/ hop off bus stop was just down the road too. We could walk to the spanish steps in 5/10 mins! Overall, we found the hotel to be more than adequate. location was the main factor and for the price it was fine. I would recommend this hotel and should we return to Rome i imagine we would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location; well that's all actually...”
Reviews.Author: SeamasterFrance
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment we had with my girlfriend staying at this hotel. The room was large but the furniture is horribly outfashioned, sometimes dirty or broken, A/C broken too, bathroom almost clean, and a TV that must be at least 15 years old. Given the rate that they charged per night (180€), I think that they could consider a serious refurbishment. The location is indeed great and it's quiet so if they were willing to invest, it could be a great place to stay. The breakfast was quite good though the orange juice was not fresh which is always a criteria for me. The service in general is not so good. No late check-out offered if you're not ready to pay an extra charge (and I wasn't asking for a 18:00 late check out, I'm talking 14:00) I definitely won't stay there again. Many other nicer options in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Quiet. Large rooms.”
Reviews.Author: NicolesTravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a week in Rome with my husband. Rooms are huge and clean. Staff accomodating. Not fancy by any means but does the trick. Good location, just a few steps from the Piazza del Popolo and walking distance to most major sites. Safe area even late in the evening. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The construction work has finished”
Reviews.Author: Parf
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 2 days in the hotel during the day on a training course. Given the recent reviews I chose not to stay in the hotel overnight. However I can confirm that the building work has finished and the hotel is very peaceful. The public areas are superb and the lunches were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever”
Reviews.Author: Aussie6
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for one night (thank heavens only one) after a cruise and before our departure back to Australia. When we arrived it was a construction site. I think we were the only people on our floor and the entire floor was covered with cardboard boxes which make wheeling our suitcases very difficult. No one offered to help and we were left to find our own room. Somebody started using a vacuum cleaner outside our room at 9.30pm making it impossible to sleep, I rang reception and they stopped him only to have him start up again a few minutes later. The kitchen in our room didn't have any water connected to it so was useless. Breakfast was very average and they had run out of most things by the time we went down at 9.30. Catching a taxi was very difficult as they couldn't stop outside the hotel and we had to wait quite a while for one that would stop. This put a very sour note to the end of an otherwise fantastic trip.

Reviews.Title: “UNFORTUNATELY BAD...”
Reviews.Author: Egli_1980
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome for our honeymoon and we chose "Residenza di Ripetta" because of the reviews of Tripadvisor and the location. First of all as per the location was great and very close to almost everywhere.. But this was the only great thing about the hotel. When we first entered we faced a huge mess.. The hotel was under re-construction, there were workers everywhere who were painting all the walls around and making noise.. The employees there were everything but kind and helpful. No one knew if we were staying at the hotel, neither our room number etc. As per the rooms.. OMG! Awfull, just awfull! Broken walls, a blue dirty carpet (with chips on it), towels that were smelling like dead people and very very noisy plumping! All furniture were very old (probably since early 60's-70's) and a fantastic view to the workers outside..! No one ever informed us that the hotel would be under re-construction and when we sent an email before our arrival - just to confirm our room and reservation - they simply never answered us! So kind and helpful.. I would definetely never go to that place again and of course would NEVER recommend it to anyone else..! Very very... very BAD! So sad for such a historic place and building.. shame on them.. P.S. We only rated the hotel for its location, which was really fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, clean and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: 50somethingyork
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residenza di Ripetta for one week in the middle of August. The hotel is very conveniently located less than five minutes walk from the Piazza del Popolo and the Spanish Steps. We were able to walk to all the great sights of Rome, the Colosseum, the Vatican, the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, the Jewish Ghetto, Trastevere, etc. We were welcomed by very helpful English speaking staff. Our rooms were very spacious - we travelled with our 20 year old son and both our rooms had a sitting area (with sofa bed) a dining table and chairs, a two ring hob and small sink, a large refrigerator, crockery, cutlery and pans so that we could "eat in" if we chose. The very large beds were firm but comfortable, the rooms were airconditioned and very peaceful - no traffic or any other noise! The hotel was in the process of some refurbishment whilst we were there and the rooms we had were certainly a little faded so maybe they are due for redecoration? The TV only had one English channel - BBC world news. There is an internet room for guests use in the lobby of the hotel. 5 euros for an hour or 10 euros for 24 hours. The breakfast buffet was generally good - fruit juices, fresh fruit, bacon, sausage, scrambled egg, cereals, pastries, bread rolls, cakes and hot drinks. Our only criticisms of the hotel would have to be that neither of our rooms had any view whatsoever - they looked out onto a rendered wall. If we were staying there again we would ask for a room with a view of the internal courtyard which was well tended and a nice place to sit, having chairs and tables with parasols. The other disappointment was that the roof terrace was rather neglected - much of the planting was dead or dying through lack of water and it seemed to us that it was a really useful space which could have been made much better use of by the hotel - a plunge pool would have been good and perhaps a bar or cafe - but there may not be sufficient demand? We also thought that the hotel bar/restaurant should have opened longer - it seemed to close by about 7.30 p.m. - we would certainly have gone into the bar for a "nightcap" had it been open when we got back into the hotel after dinner at one of the many local restaurants. The transfer time from the FCO airport was about 25 mins. by city taxi (white cars) which operate at a standard rate of 40 euros each way - don't get persuaded into another type of taxi at the airport (there are lots of touts) as it will cost you a lot more!!

Reviews.Title: “Lacks style and charm but sleeps well”
Reviews.Author: robertguarnieri
Reviews.Content: Big, bland rooms. Decent breakfast. Does not look like a location but Rome is so small it does not matter. Easy to Spanish Steps, Vatican and a quick taxi anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but when you see the main website you will be tricked by the picture in the top”
Reviews.Author: JoshuaPoon
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot of good facilities and a good breakfast. But please beware of the gypsies (also known as pickpockets) that surround the hotel. I advise you try not to go to the city and trains. If you do, you would prefer to have a lock for every important thing you have near to your body.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: sunlover21
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel. We were with our 14 year old son. The room was really spacious and on 2 levels which gave us all some privacy during the stay. It was like a small apartment with dining table and basic kitchen facilities if you want t eat in - which we didn't - I was on holiday too! The breakfast is described as " American" so my son expected pancakes and waffles which were not on offer ( so he stayed in bed after the first morning) but a good selection of cereal, pastry goods, fruit, yoghurts and a hot selection were available. The table was constantly topped up right until the bitter end so everyone got the full choice. The location of the hotel was very good. A couple of minutes from the metro providing liknks to all the major attractions but within 10 minutes walk of the spanish steps and trevi fountain. This was our first visit to Rome which we loved and will return soon. I will not hesitate to stay and this hotel again for its location, space and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, service, room size, cleanliness and breakfast! Star Service!”
Reviews.Author: SLM_Malta
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just off Piazza del Popolo - 2 mins walk away. Via Ripetta actually leads into the Piazza. The street is also Parellel with Via Del Corso and Via Del Babuino (the street that starts from the Spanish Steps and leads to Piazza del Popolo). This means that The Spanish Steps, Fontane di Trevi and Pantheon are all within 10/20 mins walking distance. Piazza Venezia and then the Colosseum are also within walking distance (20/30 mins). The hotel is very clean and has very large rooms which is not normal for good central hotels in Rome. Our group consisted of 2 adults and 2 children (12 & 8) and we had a very large room with sofa bed, large dining table, small kitchen, and a second large bedroom. The buffet breakfast was very good with a mix of english (bacon, eggs and sausages) and continental. The reception staff were very vert helpful and also spoke English.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at Ripetta's Residence Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chicapoetisa
Reviews.Content: Very good customer service. Near many attractions. Very safe area. Made us feel as part of their family. Pretty and clean facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay! Will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: elena_greek
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is excellent, right in the centre and in walking distance of everything. Our room ( nr 105 ) was surprisingly spacious and very warm although outside was close to 0 degrees. Great breakfast - the buffet was always full whether you went there at 7 or near closing time! Very helpful and polite staff - especially at the reception. They even let us stay until 17:00 without charging us, even though check out time was at 10:30 in the morning. It was certainly comforting for us to find out that some hotels will still go that extra mile to keep the customer satisfied! Overall a very fulfilling experience. Would definitely recommend it. Eleni - Panos Athens Greece

Reviews.Title: “Great aparthotel in very central location”
Reviews.Author: Irishman01
Reviews.Content: We rented a 2-bed apartment in Residenza di Ripetta for 6 people. There were 4 double beds, 2 in separate bedrooms and 2 in the large sitting room. The apartment was spacious and was in good condition overall - it would have benefited from having a second bathroom as 6 people sharing on ebathroom and shower is not ideal! The hotel is very centrally located and most of the key sights of Rome are within walking distance. The breakfast was also very good and is included in the price. For Rome, this is a good value option for travelling with a large group.
